key_points: Fall River Police Department in Massachusetts apologized for a controversial Facebook post criticizing George Floyd.
The post referenced Derek Chauvin's verdict, suggesting George Floyd should have behaved as Chauvin did at his arrest.
The post led to wide condemnation from the public on social media.
Fall River Police Chief Jeffrey Cardoza announced the post's removal and apologized.
An officer thought they were re-posting to their personal page, leading to the mistake.
The officer involved has been reassigned to non-public-contact duties.
An external investigator will review the case.
Chief Cardoza emphasized the incident does not reflect the department's values and mentioned ongoing training for fair policing.
Fall River Mayor Paul Coogan stated the officer is remorseful and feels he let people down.
The incident is under investigation, and disciplinary actions could be taken.
spokespersons: Jeffrey Cardoza (Police Chief, Fall River Police Department)
